website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a smaller computer case with decent features and a price that falls on the lower end of the range, this one is worth a look.
pros: Features magnetic dust cover filters that are easy to remove and put back into place
Has rounded edges and a well-made acrylic panel
Not too tall, making it ideal for areas with limited space
cons: Cable management system is lacking and needs more cutouts to be effective
The downside of the compact design is its lack of ample interior space
Some screws, holes, and components don't line up precisely

customer_reviews.title: Misaligned holes = no fan support for top
customer_reviews.text: All the holes are misaligned. 120 or 140mm fans will not work in the top. None of the holes line up anywhere. Also what is the point of bottom fan support if the thing barely sits 2mm off the ground? Moved my build from a HAF 932 Advanced to this, which was a huge downsize in case, but upsize space saved and portability.
customer_reviews.author: flux

customer_reviews.title: TRANSPARENT PANEL CAME SCRATCHED
customer_reviews.text: transparent panel came scratched, tried to clean it and this must be the softest acrylic ever, just made it worse when using a clean microfiber cloth i use to clean my screen. Very angry because i didnt notice till my whole system was built. now i have to completely disassemble my pc AGAIN to change cases
customer_reviews.author: Nick Stabile

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Quiet & cool
customer_reviews.text: First time builder . It’s nice and small. I bought 4 fans Arctic pwm pst fans. I took out the one that came with it. The thing is so quiet!!!! Everything stays cool! All my parts fit perfect . I added padding on the feet to raise it for the psu fan. I played call of duty on ultra 1080p psu and gpu stay in the 40-50’s C“ MY BUILD MSi B450M PRO VDH MAX Ryzen 3600x Corsair 450 bronze Geofororce 1660 super G.skills 16gb 2x8 3200 M2 500gb Barracuda 2tb 7200 Arctic pst fans 4 of them .
customer_reviews.author: Luis Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: Hot Master ToastyBox Q300P
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Looks sharp. - RGB goodness. - Cable management is awesome. - Case is built solid. - Manual is reasonable for parts assembly. Cons: - Near Zero Airflow. - Plexiglass front/top cover hinders all airflow. - PCI slot covers only come off, not back on. - Manual is horrible showing RGB connectivity. - Would some extra screws kill ya? Sadly, I had to return this case. Even after adding another intake fan, it was just too hot unless I left off the plexiglass...and even then it wasn't great. One can find videos and discussions about cutting/drilling holes...but that's not what I paid for. BTW, running a 2600X with a RTX 2070. Going back to the tried-n-true N200 for now.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Robinson III

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you are on an extreme budget, otherwise spend another $20
customer_reviews.text: I built a system around an AMD Ryzen 3 3200G and didn't want a case that cost nearly as much or more than the processor. The Q300L had decent reviews and I'd seen it in a bunch of builds on Youtube. Pros - Pretty light weight. - Good locations for SSD & HDD Cons - The screw holes for case fans were too small. Had to drill them a little bigger. - The power button / usb panel is really cheap. The power button broke off when I moved the location from side to top. - The magnetic dust filters are annoying when you need to move the case around. They easily slide out of place.
customer_reviews.author: True

customer_reviews.title: Turn around and run away.
customer_reviews.text: This case is absolute trash. Where do I start? Not enough screws for an arc board even tho they have 9 standoffs pre installed and I'm missing 4. The threads are all different between standoffs. The case flexes once you get everything installed. They don't tell you the side panels isn't glass. I build high end gaming rigs and am well knowing in the modding community. Cooler master what in the heck is wrong with you? I could live with not enough screws being provided but most don't have thousands of PC screws laying around.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Perdue

customer_reviews.title: Can't think of a better case for $39
customer_reviews.text: If you're on a budget this is a nice bang for your buck case. I was doing a budget build with some parts I had laying around and was in need of a case. I was looking for something small/budget friendly/and clean looking- it's safe to say I found all that with the Cooler Master Q300L. *Mini Tower case *comes with 1 rear case fan * Cleanly and easy to mount one 3.5" & two 2 2.5" hard drives *Decent air-flow *Magnetic dust filters (Top/Front/Bottom) *Room for cable-management
customer_reviews.author: Timo_Tech

customer_reviews.title: Great budget case
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely compact but I managed to fit an: ATX board 240mm AIO CPU cooler (Bottom) Semi modular PSU Dual Fan GPU (May fit a GPU longer than 11" if configured right ie. sacrifice and intake fan to make room) 140mm exhaust fan (Top) 120mmx2 (1 exhaust and 1 intake) 2TB HDD (Back) The case does have some heating issues. To mitigate overheating I put all fans, except CPU, on full speed and flip the case so the transparent panel is facing up. Afterwards I haven't had any heating issues.
customer_reviews.author: MochaJojo

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Worth it?: 5/5 cheap case, you get what t pay for. I like this product and will buy it again if the need arises. Quality?: 3/5 Not metal, worried about longevity. Filter on the bottom of the case is held on by stupid ruber studs. It's not going to last. Case came with some plastic compression studs that just don't last very long. Fit?: 3/5 I can't seem to find the right spot to mount a radiator. If the mobo mounts sat +1" up or down everything would have been easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Millman

customer_reviews.title: Worst ideas in a small box
customer_reviews.text: This pc case is just stupid. The pre installed fan is backward, the side panel screws on one side are rubber, the design on the front and top are just metal meshes that are magnetic, so any time you need to move the computer they slide off and cause a potential dropping hazard. The power supply bracket is inset and you have to take it out. The PCI screws are meant to be held with a cover over your components, instead of being screwed in directly. God this case is just awful.
customer_reviews.author: HiveTyrant36

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for a new build and it seems okay so far. One issue I had with it were that the instructions were not terribly clear. When it came time to install the SSD, I found that the hard drive mounts did not have mounting points for my SSD. Thankfully I found a work around and was able to get it to work. The case is decent quality, we will see how it holds up... my main issue with the quality so far is that the magnets which hold the cover on could be stronger. It’s okay for a budget case.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case, but HORRRRRRRRIBLE air flow
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this case, and it was really nice to build in. Cable mgmt was a breeze with the generous amount of space behind the motherboard. However, this case is an OVEN. Airflow is absolutely atrocious. My rx 5700 was hitting 90 degrees c with 6 fans installed. Taking off the acrylic side panel resulted in the GPU running at 78 c. This case gets zero stars for its horrible airflow. Do not buy unless you want to fry eggs on your GPU and bake a loaf of bread.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great Sized Case, not incredibly terrible airflow, magenetic dust covers are cool but not great.
customer_reviews.text: This case is known for it's poor airflow thanks to the stylized panels that are on the front and back of the case. There are predrilled holes, none of which are case fan sized, and do restrict airflow somewhat. With a decent enough cooling system you should be just fine. The magnetic dust filters make the computer annoying to carry around but otherwise were functional and pretty cool looking.
customer_reviews.author: robsta109

customer_reviews.title: Fine Budget Case
customer_reviews.text: Just completed a budget build for a customer with this case. Very aesthetically pleasing with fantastic airflow in the main component cavity. The metal is thin, but that is to be expected at this price point. Also, the front intake fan screw holes are very tight and will require quite a bit of force as you fasten the fans. Just be sure to apply pressure on the backside of the fans so you don't bow the sides of the frame out. Also, SSDs would be my recommendation in this case. Hard drives will not get much airflow if mounted per the intended design. I would not have any objection to using this case with future builds.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher & Joy

customer_reviews.title: this case for the price of this case is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: When I was doing research about this case I had heard a lot of mixed reviews about it. when I got this case for my first build it was amazing, especially all the space for cable management, im not inexperienced with computers but have never actually built one, this case blew my expectations and would definitely recommend if your on a budget. the airflow can be a little scary though if you only have one exhaust fan, which at the moment I do Rn because my motherboard doesn't support more than one fan. I got a fan hub to put 3 more fans in but besides that this case is an amazing budget case.
customer_reviews.author: Honi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment in a box
customer_reviews.text: At first I was rather excited about my case but after a few months of ownership I realized how crappy this case was. The magnetic filters don't filter out all that much I often find myself popping open my PC and cleaning it out. The bottom of the PC has rubber feet that pop out with a slightest hint of force. The mesh on the under side of case bends and contorts again with little to no force. I just wanted to protect the parts I spent a bit of money on not cover them in dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: To the point: 1. Full size power supply fits; access to secure screws is a little tight; only adds a little time. I like that its recessed into the case about 1in 2. Using low db fans keeps noise level whisper quiet; three total - back, top and front (120mm) 3. Using AMD Ryzen 3400G means there is plenty of room in the case without graphics card Overall I really like the case as it kept things simple, quiet and small footprint. It has a sturdy feel; the magnetic filters are a nice touch and easy to remove if desired.
customer_reviews.author: Help-Me-Help-You

customer_reviews.title: Poorly ventilated
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a fairly simple set up - ATX motherboard, AMD CPU (3700x) and Nvidia GPU (1070ti) with 16 GB of RAM and two 3.5" HDDs. Over a week of testing, my core temperatures averaged 60 C while IDLING. I didn't risk a test under load. Adding a fan did not help, as the crammed components restrict airflow. It barely sits off the ground, which means floor mounted fans won't do much. Additionally, the trade off with the small footprint is that with the above components, installation became tedious as I had to contort to get everything plugged in. On the plus side, it looks great, is compact, and comes with plenty of zip ties and screws.
customer_reviews.author: Karthik V.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and small but wait there's more!
customer_reviews.text: Nice and small and looks good but the front panel audio jack of the one i got is broken, i tried to plug in my headphone not all the way in and it will work but if i tried to plug it in all the way in my pc will restart, and the air flow on this suck, i tried to add more 120mm fan. 2 exhaust 2 intake and boom! I created my personal heater for my room, the holes in this case is too small for air to get in and out, so if planing to buy DIY heater this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Resty

customer_reviews.title: Budget case ftw
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable and worth what I paid. Will 100% do the job. connectivity issues with wireless mouse and keyboard on front USB panel have to plug from the back Will make for a good build. Includes all hardware. Can be laid on side or up right. Fits b450 motherboard and dual fan graphic card. Had room for 1 HDD and 2-3 ssd Has good cable management Case will run pretty hot. Boths panels aren't ported but the sides have plenty ventilation. The 2 magnetic filters included are siiiick will keep dust out.
customer_reviews.author: Shinobiwizard

customer_reviews.title: Dope.
customer_reviews.text: This case is easy to build in, has a ton of options for placement of internal components and allows for you to use the case either vertically or in a horizontal configuration. The acrylic side panel is not exactly scratch resistant. My biggest complaint would be that the included magnetic dust filters on the front and top panel are easily moved around. I would've liked to have seen maybe some grooves for the filters to sit in so that they are more stable. I have a 240MM Radiator on the front panel of this case and with some RGB Lights, it looks pretty good. No frills, great airflow. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Shoesmith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build in, need more fans for powerful system
customer_reviews.text: Ample space behind motherboard for cable routing, but no power supply shroud. With just a little effort you can make it look decent enough even using a non modular power supply. The plastic side panel and thin metal frame make it seem cheap, but its built to a price and at this price it is good value. With only one case fan, the thermals can leave something to be desired in more powerful systems. A Ryzen 5 1600/RX570 build maintains great temps though. Add a couple on the front and you'll be good for more CPU/GPU
customer_reviews.author: Donnypanda

customer_reviews.title: Strong MATX case for the price point. Think before you start building.
customer_reviews.text: Probably would be better if this was a MITX case. Cable routing would be better than it is today. That said it is not horrible. You can fit AIO on the front but I doubt it will fit on the top. MATX MB sits really close to the top so getting pump hoses to CPU would be difficult. Fits a EVGA RTX 2080 three slot XC Ultra - no problem.
customer_reviews.author: AldermanAl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap case that looks nice and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: its thin stamped steel, it feels as such, but it looks modern and slick for the price point. Cable management is relatively easy, there is tons of holes and space to run cables through the inside, and the front panel has tons of mounting holes for really any size or amount of fans you want to toss at it. Overall, its great for a budget build (which is exactly what I used it for), it looks great when you toss a few LED fans at it too. I used it to build a mid-range gaming PC for my living room, and I get comments on how it looks in my entertainment stand all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Nice for price. Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I love the case, but it didn't come with instructions so go on YouTube and find out how psu installs. Other then that, it came with all the hardware you would expect from a case. I installed two front 120 fans and it's doing the job. I have a gforce 2070 and an asus B550 using a 3600x with wraith cooler. Only use modular power supplies with this case....Period. Not a bad matx case at all. Just watch some videos to really see how things fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapbast...

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst case, not amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's a $40 case, so you can't expect a ton of features. The plexiglass has a nice smoke tint, but it is plexiglass so it will scratch easily. The pci slots are stamped as part of the chassis, so it's not very clean. The magnetic filters are nice, but a little too easy to remove, so much that it can slide off unintentionally just moving the chassis around. At the very least, most cable pass throughs are rolled, so no sharp edges, and the case has great space for a micro atx and a full sized gpu. The build quality is okay, but again, you can't ask for much out of a $40 case.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Could be better, but understandable for the price
customer_reviews.text: This case is a mixed bag. The form factor and interior mounting for the PSU leaves a lot to be desired, and needs a lot of fan coverage to cool this. My suggestion heavily it to spring for a modular PSU if you're using this case, otherwise your cable management will be a nightmare. There are better cases, but at the price it's understandable. EDIT: While not an Mini-ATX case specifically, some of these issues can be resolved building with Mini-ATX on even ITX motherboards with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Typhus

customer_reviews.title: Unprotected holes, no DVD/BR player
customer_reviews.text: Update: Added one star because the poor air filtration efficiency is standard for computer cases; standard computer fans just don't create enough pressure to be able to filter air better. Had to use masking tape to block the holes not even covered by the coarse mesh (e.g., near the exhaust fan, you can see the uncovered holes in the product's pictures) ---------- The dust filters don't cover all holes, and the filter holes are so coarse they will only stop dust bunnies. One of the dust filters was folded away from the case due to how it was (mis)packaged. To my dismay, there's no opening for my DVD player. Style over function.
customer_reviews.author: healthy tech

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: This case looks better in person than it does online so that's nice. And I like that it has USB plugs on the side. You can position it in an upright position or on it's side, it has little feet for either. It comes with two decorative mesh panels that are held on by magnets. They look nice. The only downside is the magnets aren't very strong. I have my computer under my desk and if my pants leg brush against it at all it pulls the mesh panel off the front. Not a big deal but a little irritating. I just took it off and out it on top.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: I didn't get the case I ordered....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered The Q300L but I received a Masterbox Lite 3.1. And judging by the photos here no one has the Q300L so why is it listed for sale? I specifically wanted that case because it was perforated all over and has great air-flow. This MB Lite 3.1 has a solid plastic cover over the front... PLEASE STOP MAKING CASES LIKE THIS! They provide little to NO airflow! And all the fans in the world won't help if they're blocked from the front by a plastic of glass panel. Does it look nice? Yes. Is it practical for long-term use? No.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget option below $50
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good budget case for below $50. I’ve build several budget gaming PCs using this case. It has some short comings but the price makes up for that. Pros: Very affordable Looks sleek and interesting Great dust management Plenty of room for even large coolers and GPUs (Hyper 212 & RX-580) Cons: Magnetic covers aren’t very strong Side tint is so dark you can’t see inside (kinda defeats the purpose of it) Case is very thin leaving a lot of flex Airflow isn’t the best (needs another 1-2x 120mm fan)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin King

customer_reviews.title: Compact..but this ain't it.
customer_reviews.text: It's compact with great aesthetic. A great case when you're in a budget. You don't have much room to work on, cable management is okay-ish, it does get really hot inside with the filters on the case. I can't recommend this for beginners. For people building their first PC go for an NZXT510 if you're looking for a mid-tower build, however, if you're really going for a micro-atx build go for the Cooler Master NR400.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian MC

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a weird case but very nice once you do the installs
customer_reviews.text: Loaded it with four fans. Installed a previous gen AMD fx-8350 and 990 amd board. The air flow is adequate but could be better. The fine mesh holes in the magnetic covers limit airflow a little. Recently changed the components installed to a Ryzen 7 1700x, mini-itx board, gtx 1050 graphics card. No heat issues at all using stock cpu cooler and one intake fan in front, two exit air fans in the roof. No cable routing issues, room for two 2.5" drives on the right side next to the MB and room for one 3.5" drive in the back. I like that it is less than 15" deep.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Peel

customer_reviews.title: So many dents = hard to build
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. As soon as I open the wrapping, little black bits and pieces fall off. I notice there’s dents everywhere, missing legs, etc. I’m like whatever, it looks mostly just cosmetic, but when I’m building it I’m struggling with putting in the power supply because the dent pushing in literally is preventing me from sliding the power supply any further so I just left it there unscrewed. When I tried screwing in the glass panel, (I bet you can tell what’s coming next) the dent rendered it physically impossible so I only have the top two screws screwed in. All in all, don’t purchase, go the extra dollar to get you an actual working case
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Chan

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Minimalistic and Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect case for those who are looking for a compact and minimalistic build. It is small that means you are going to be limited and therefore you should be careful choosing the components for it. My build: MoBo: Asus ROG Strix B350-F GPU: Nvidia GTX 1070Ti (Gigabyte Windforce 3X) CPU Cooler: Corsair Hydro H60 Everything fit just perfect and compactly beautiful...
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Moncion

customer_reviews.title: Full size components in a mid size tower
customer_reviews.text: Building a full size PC in this mid size tower was fun and challenging. There are a few things that could be improved but overall I LOVE this case! Cons: Front panel connector is not the standard usb 3.0 plug that most motherboards support so you'll likely have to buy an adapter. This case does not have the best airflow but is sufficient if water cooling Bottom dust filter is a pain to clean because it is not magnetic like the front and top dust filters Pros: Deep compartment behind motherboard for easy wire management Extremely modular placement of fans, PSU and front IO Everything else!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking case
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice looking case but not much more than that. Has an acrylic panel that might come scratched like mine. Besides the acrylic panel, the build quality is fine. Air flow is sub par. Comes with one 120mm fan in the back and has room for 2 140mm in the front. It's pretty easy to build in and I had no problems regarding that. It has about an inch in the back for cable management. Exapndablity is pretty limited with only two 2.5in drive bays and one 3.5in one. It's a pretty good, nice looking case for the price however is you're a function over form type of person you may want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Bluechimecho

customer_reviews.title: hard to build in
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the case is incredible and looks amazing. With that being said the case was a b*tch to work on. The graphic cards slots are screwable, you have to remove them with force. Oh and btw if you mess it up you can't add them back. The hard drive mounting system is garbage, even after its mounted properly its not secured all the way down. The hard drive kinda just hangs, if the pc is moved the hard drive will move. For 20 dollars more you can get a much better case like the nzxt h510.
customer_reviews.author: Darien C

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: Zero issues with this case. Arrived well-packed and intact. No scratches on the Plexi panel, all hardware present. All parts fit correctly and my build was done in an hour or so. Not as much room for full size magnetic drives (OS on M.2, but need the extra storage) so I had to improvise a bit, but if space was a top priority I would have bought a bigger case. Great value for the money and it looks decent as well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Baker

customer_reviews.title: It work both air and water cooler
customer_reviews.text: One of the best air cases to get. Wish they had more pattern to choose from. Or even better choose your own print as a special order .i also wish they had a eatx version. Careful with the bottom filter. I lost 3 rubber plugs that hold in place and folded it moving the case around installing the hardware. Best to take it off until your done flipping it all over the place doing cable management. Ohh it’s sturdy enough with everything in it. I would buy another but don’t need 2 cases with the same print.
customer_reviews.author: Erik M.

customer_reviews.title: Fits where others do not
customer_reviews.text: This was the only case I could find to fit a full size atx mobo in the limited height space I had for it. I was worried about the way the power supply mounts inside the case to the front, but that ended up being no issue. The filters that cover the outside of the case seem to work well and the case runs as cool as the full size case it replaced. It also has a unique understated look. All in all Im happy with this item and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne McGee

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. (Doesn't come with handles)
customer_reviews.text: The product description says that you can only put 2 120mm on top and 1 on bottom but you can easily put 140mm all the way around EXCEPT for the rear. Pleanty of room for cables management. I've read reviews where people get it with magnet screens bent and the cables inside not tied down properly so the scratch the acrylic panel. I had neither of those problem. It was packaged well and the cables were secure. Would highly recomend and I myself will be using it again on next build.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle G

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice small matx.
customer_reviews.text: Nice small footprint, it would have been 5 stars but the theaded holes for the standoffs are about two threads thick. Be careful or you will strip the threads. Also would have got 5 stars if all the storage mounts would have supported 3.5 or 2.5 drives, however I can see where it would make the case about 3/4 inch thicker. Like all other small cases, you get either a 5.25 bay or room for a liquid radiator fan. This case is for fans. It’s hard to find quality cases that are not geared toward “epic beard Starbucks skinny pants flashing bling light gamers” now a days.
customer_reviews.author: GSMarquis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty case, thermals not so much.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice case for the price if all you consider is aesthetics. If you're making a really low end computer, and i mean something below RTX 1660 or RX570 then this case should be erect. But for the GPU's i mention i highly recommend a better case since it could get pretty hot inside the case and affect your CPU temps. Also the panel might come scratched like mine, but cooler master sent me a new none scratched one without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: JL420

customer_reviews.title: Sizes and set ups vary. Noisy and warm, this case could be better
customer_reviews.text: Had to change to a smaller GPU because with a standard 850W PSU, a 12 inch GPU doesn’t fit with an ATX setup, regardless of reported fit by coolermaster. Case does the job for a desktop PC for someone who doesn’t game however. Changed from a stock AMD cooler to a Be Quiet dual fan cooler and saw a drop in temps but wouldn’t recommend an overclock as it’s a very noisy case. Fan noise is a problem
customer_reviews.author: Alex Cywan

customer_reviews.title: It's a case. Not packed well, materials are okay at best.
customer_reviews.text: Case came kind of beat up, even without a dent on the box. The aluminum is really thin, and I wouldn't buy it again. For my purposes it'll be fine, but for most people who will care, don't buy this. No mounting for additional case fans, from what I can tell. Very barebones. Just fine for a set it and forget it PC or when you don't need a lot of cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Manners

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap case
customer_reviews.text: I like this case a lot, It's not that big, it includes a pre-installed fan on the rear (it's only 3 pins meaning you cant control the speed of it), It has a bunch of space in the back to hide cables, it has a clear side panel, good airflow and you can mount it horizontally or vertically. I liked everything about this case except for one thing, the front panel, the USB and headphone jack isn't that great, It's hard to plug things into them but I mean you can move the front panel around and overall It has all the features you would want at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Decent but only when on sale and under $35 - no where near worth it for more than that
customer_reviews.text: Filters are terrible, glue hangs off from the attached magnets. The bottom filters hardly stays on properly. So cheap you wonder why they even had any. Pretty much have to arrange the power button panel before building. Default position hardly has enough length to hide wires. Best configuration would be with the panel on the bottom. So far I have built in every Masterbox model and this is definitely the weakest and should be avoided unless you HAVE to. I have built in better cases for under $30.
customer_reviews.author: rockwithg

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I assembled a low end gaming machine for the big screen TV (enough to play Skyrim), and noticed how quiet this box is. I was considering going with a fanless Intel NUC because fan noise is high on my consideration. I am glad I went with this box instead because the fan is barely noticeable. The unit also comes with some magnetic dust filters, an attractive addition and makes cleanup easier. However, screwing in the motherboard is not as easy as some of the alternative models. Overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great starter case
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my first PC build because I wanted to spend most of my money on the parts. It was a little difficult getting my CPU in there but it's a very sturdy and durable case. The window is kind of like plexiglass which I didn't mind since I've taken it off so many times already to add or adjust components. The system fan ran fine so I have no complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: worst case ever
customer_reviews.text: This case completely sucks. It took hours and hours to get built. The power supply has to be attached to a bracket that makes it an inch longer, why? I couldn't even get the top fans mounted because there is not enough clearance between the top of the case and the CPU power plug, argh! So much for using all the fans I bought. Airflow is restricted by lots of metal and few holes. Hate this case, no one should buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony U

customer_reviews.title: Airflow is lacking, Cable management is great.
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for my server application, but the airflow is a bit lacking. Other than that its one of the best cases I've built in. Cable management is a huge part of making any pc look nice and this case does it really well. I like the power supply on the side, so I can fit my full atx board in here. I would prefer a tempered glass panel over the plexiglas one, but it still looks nice and will probably be better in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic input panel clips broke!
customer_reviews.text: After installing everything, our son realized the plastic clips to hold the input panel in place snapped! After a couple weeks he was too frustrated with it and I convinced him to return it. He shouldn't have to compromise for something he paid his hard earned money for! This is why we buy most things through Amazon now, the return policy is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Wal92tt

customer_reviews.title: Great Space Heater
customer_reviews.text: This product should be called a Space Heater not Cool Master I had to take off the side panel for airflow even after adding 3 more fans to keep my system from overheating would give it a 0 if I could . Never had the problem with my old case pretty sure the full covered plastic in the front doesn't help the RGB fans only make it look pretty nothing more whatever you do avoid buying this case. There are much better options at cheaper prices one of the buying points for me was 2 day shipping with Prime that still took over a week to get.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Shade of black is much darker in person!
customer_reviews.text: This case is a lot smaller than you’d expect! I would recommend using a smaller board than a full ATX, but it is possible! That being said, if you want a full ATX but not a gigantic case, this is a great option! Also note that the case is a far darker shade of black in person than in the photos. The photos lead me to believe that it was a gray case, but it is not. Definitely black. Only comes with one fan, but it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Erohs1

customer_reviews.title: Decent, room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: In terms of material quality, the construction of the unit was as expected for price. However, I was displeased with the use of plastic as opposed to tempered glass. This gave it a sub-par feeling to me, however there is ample space for wire management behind the opposite door. I suggest pairing this unit with a full-modular power supply, as there's so partition to separate the PSU bay from the rest of the case, making it difficult to be aesthetically pleasing. The air flow is also not up to par with what you'd assume a fully vented case would provide, and for similar price the Thermaltake H18 is a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case
customer_reviews.text: It's compact, has good looks, and is perfect. The Q300L arrives in perfect condition. It was complete, and all my components fit like a glove. For my mid-range, gaming PC build, I added 2 front 140mm fans (which it was perfectly prefit for), which keep the GPU temps right around 70 degrees (C). I kept the rear 120mm fan it came with and set it to full speed 100% of the time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as possible.
customer_reviews.text: My second PC build. Glad this case wasn't my first. Wierd mounting position for the power supply. You need to remove the glass to switch the physical PS on and off. I reccomend the NZXT 500. So many reasons it's better. Glass panel, correct mounting for power supply, cable management, and more. For 15 bucks difference. I liked the magnetic dust screens of this case and the overall look of it.
customer_reviews.author: C0SM0 SIX5

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: The overall case quality is good, i see some reviews complaining about the getting their cases damaged - my case came in perfect shape with all screws and some extras. The highlight of the case is the design of the dust covers, and the clear panel is also nice. My main complaint with this case is the hard to remove brackets for the graphics card, the brackets were not easy at all to pop out and the perforations were insufficient, leading me to bend them in an effort to remove them which lead to some minor scratches on the motherboard. Temps on this thing are not the best but they get the job done most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but relatively sturdy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it's a pretty good case. The screen on the bottom gets snagged on everything and I ended up ripping it off. The magnetic screen on the front and top are pretty weak and fall off if you bump them all. The instructions are terrible. Again, for a cheap case, this does what you need it to do. You won't find a better case at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Schoob

customer_reviews.title: It is the perfect little case
customer_reviews.text: I have had this case for about 2 years now. Its perfect for me, I painted the side to fit the theme I wanted. It fixes perfectly on my desk. It is easy to clean when needed. Everything is nicely presented. The other panel is plastic which I like personally. it is a little dark tinted so having adequate lighting in the case will be needed if you want to see everything clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Great case, but it needs more rubber feet for harddrives. It would not hurt to have an extra slot on the back side of the motherboard for a 3.5. It has one but needs another one. the punchout for the pci devices is a pain when you have to bend them back and forth. Be careful not to cut your self on the tin. But I do like the case. I do plan to buy another one and rebuild my server.
customer_reviews.author: SBphoto42

customer_reviews.title: Not what was expected
customer_reviews.text: The held in place by rubber buttons bottom screen came off during the build. The magnetic screens that attempt to double as a design feature are a fail since the edges don't appear to be smoothly finished. If you will be happy with a perforated box covered by a couple of screens held on by magnets, then go for it. I had read the reviews but it still wasn't what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: M. Penton

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but a tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: Might just be me, but I struggle putting the back panel on after screwing with something like my hard drive or SSD. It’s probably just the unmanaged cables in the back, but it’s a little hard to put panels on if your cables are thick. It’s looks great where it’s supposed to otherwise, and serves the purpose of looking nice on my desk. MAtx might not be the best option if you have a lot of things, such as multiple hard drives, SLI Video cards, or a big radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Power button fell off with normal use, front IO doesn't work 100%
customer_reviews.text: I'm still using this case after buying it approx 6 months ago. The power button is mounted in the front IO with melted plastic and it is incredibly flimsy and fell off. I had to wire the reset button to the power pin on my mobo so I could have one. Also, I attempted to do some USB disk imaging and the front IO kept screwing with the process. Had to plug my device into the back IO (motherboard), which worked flawlessly on the first try. This case is a hard do not recommend and I will be changing as soon as I free up funds.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case based on the reviews. However, i should had paid attention to the 1-star reviews closer. This case does a terrible job on the PSU placement. The user doesn’t even have direct outside access to the safety switch behind the PSU.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Ariza

customer_reviews.title: Great $50 mATX case
customer_reviews.text: The Cooler Master Master box case is great for a small compact mATX build. There is plenty of room in the case for a large graphics card. The RX 590 got easy in the case. The holes for installing more fans was a bit hard to find so read the manual. The case can fit 5 fan and has great airflow. The case has plenty of room for cable management on the back. I wish it had a power supply basement but it is a $50 mATX case. The side panel and front panel connector can be moved to so that is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case!
customer_reviews.text: Great case, great airflow, only gripe is the wires to the front I/o are short which forced me to move the panel to the bottom if I didn’t want the wires/cables stretching over the mobo making it look messy. It has great cable routing holes at the top and great space in the back to hide all wires. I am a huge Minecraft fan, and the building block print on the dust covers ply into that well.
customer_reviews.author: xDaddyWolfx

customer_reviews.title: best case I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: it's mini-ATX size but fits a gtx 1070, super cool design, love it edit: this case does not have sufficient cooling capacity for high-end components. when I bought it, I had a ryzen 2600 and a GTX 960, and temperatures were good. I then upgraded to a ryzen 3800x and GTX 2080 super, and both of them reached their maximum temperatures in this case. I bought another, much larger case, and they ran way cooler. so don't buy this if you're getting very high-end parts
customer_reviews.author: Huskehn

customer_reviews.title: No internal parts or structures included
customer_reviews.text: The case shouldn't be a problem. This one is. Maybe it's OK if you have a well supplied shop. Otherwise, steer clear. No SATA drive mounting structures provided, just some screw holes and screws in the backplate. I had to fabricate something or face 3 day delay. The manufacturer should spend the few extra cents to provide at least an optional mount frame. Note that this has no removable media capability One plus: lots of ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: SFCardwell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Care is pretty nice I like the magnetic cover, but some draw backs, I blame myself, only room for 1 Hard drive, but room for 2 SSD drives, and no slot ofr Optical drive. The case could have come with a bigger cooling fan in the rear, as some of the space is wasted, you will need to order atleast 2 more fans, I have a total of 4 one in the back, one up top and 2 in the front, air flow is great, and as I said, the filters are rinse in water and dry. I would get a bigger one next time with more room for HD and an optical drive.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great case except for weird headphone jack
customer_reviews.text: This case was pleasant to put together, however I have an issue with the headphone jacks. Most pc cases have a headphones jack that is TRRs which means that you have earbuds/headphones with an integrated microphone. This case only has TRS which means that the microphone functionality will not work on headsets with an integrated microphone. Other than that the quality is decent but the plastic power button and IO area is pretty cheap. In 2020 not having an TRRS port is unbelievable. Please fix this Cooler Master.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel G.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to build in
customer_reviews.text: This case was difficult to build in to say the least. Installing the motherboard stand-offs did not go smoothly as it seemed like the threads within the case were damaged. Cable management is largely not something that can be done as the cutouts in the back are so large that your cables will almost always show through no matter how well managed the cables are. The mounting design for the power supply is also very strange, although it does work. Not sure why the power supply is not flush-mounted like most cases I've worked with.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It's aight
customer_reviews.text: The case is nice. You can lay it flat or you can stand it up. I wish it had a slot for a disk reader. Also the mest magnet coverings in the front and to are cool BUT they were bent on arrival. I'm still keeping it because it's annoying to return it. For sure this machine seems well ventilated.
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I rehoused my desktop into this smaller chassis and am quite happy with it. They really figured out how to fit as much as possible in a small space. If you use SSDs, you can fit 4 of them in the back side of the enclosure. The magnetic covers are a simple but attractive design and the acrylic window gives a nice video of any light-up components inside.
customer_reviews.author: Evan J.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case and great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value case! I worked on a few people’s PCs that used this case and I liked it so much I decided to buy one. Plenty of room to work with, even with it being a smaller volume case. Everything is planned out well and space smartly utilized. It looks great too. Finally moved my PC from the floor to the desk where I can see it
customer_reviews.author: Chase S.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to work in, looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the "TUF" edition as the standard was out of stock, glad I did! Feels like a classier look. For a cheap case, impressive! Came with plenty of zip ties, standoffs, screws...everything you should need to get you build going. Only complaint is the cost cutting on edge finishes - can be sharp (randomly!) but once its built I wont be in contact with those so... Budget builders - easy to work in case that looks nice and is very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Good for wire routing around the rear. You can fit 4 2.5 drives in the rear mounts I’m not sure on 3” drives. I suggest a black power supply to go in your case as it would look best no rob needed since it would be un-noticed if you face it to vent out the front. I love that you can move the front panel. I also suggest some be-quiet or other noises reducing fans.
customer_reviews.author: baltazar tabullo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing budget case
customer_reviews.text: The case itself is really sturdy, and to be honest I don't mind the front cover to be plastic instead of glass. The size itself of the case is nice and compact which I find as a plus because of lack of space. The only downside to it is that according to many people the airflow of the case itself is bad and tends to overheat. I can't personally speak for that, as I bought extra fans, but to be on the safe side I would recommend extra case fans.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Andres

customer_reviews.title: A lot of space
customer_reviews.text: Great especially for people new to building PCs. I would say the most interesting thing about the case is that the HDD/SSD are placed in the opposite side of the case. However, this allows for more space for cable management in the front. The case only came with one fan in the back for me. The fan is super quiet and you can't even tell it's spinning. Despite this, my temps are still low. I would recommend this case especially for its great price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic looks great easy to build
customer_reviews.text: I really love just everything about this. The price, the look, the ease of adding fans, and managing cables. Only down side is acrylic side vs tempered glass but come on for the price you get more than you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Case arrived undamaged and well packaged. Hardware kit was well secured and seemed to be of decent quality. This case is very easy to build in and has more than adequate cooling for most setups. I like the removable dust filter. Seems to help keep the dust out of the GPU and CPU radiator. Just pull them off and give them a rinse. If you want a big fancy case with RGB all over and tempered glass then go spend 200 on a different case. If you want a good functional case with great airflow for a reasonable price then look no further. Spend your extra money on your GPU you will be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid, well featured mATX case
customer_reviews.text: Great case, especially for the price. I've seen people say that the airflow isn't good, but just one additional 140mm fan in the front seems to keep everything in good cooling, and I'm not even sure if that was needed. It has good organization and is a great, compact size for mATX. Wish it had tempered glass panels, but that would increase the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if you want a smaller case for a normal motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case. Replaced a Corsair H500. Was able to fit everything with great cable management. I love being able to relocate the power button to any side, love how small it is, the magnetic air filters.. Great case for the money. But the window is plastic not tempered glass so it scratches easy and attracts dust like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great case, keeps my rig cool.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to stuff with everything I needed, and works coolly. Large, easy to remove and clean dust filters. Has my MSI B450M Mortar Titanium mATX board in it (Ryzen 7 2700), GTX 970 Founder's Edition, and a non-modular EVGA 500w PSU. All fits nicely, and there is PLENTY of room for cable management. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hines

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case, with lots of room. Looks really good with LED strips installed.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case, since it is very attractive, has plenty of room inside, and lets me show off the computer guts with LED light strips installed. So far, I have not scratched the clear acrylic panel, and the magnetically attached screens keep the dust down inside. HIgh quality materials and ease of fitment make this case one I would be very likely to buy if I build another PC.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Houston

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget case
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic air filters came creesed, however, the problem was easily fixed by leaving a set of books on them for a day. The fan was also defective and didn't work properly therefor needing replacement. The power button also broke off but was easily fixed with some disassembly and crazy glue. The only other problem I experienced with this build was that the plastic window came with a big un-fixable scuff/scratch. Other than that, this is a nice little budget case for budget builds and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Fellow Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget Case in My Eyes
customer_reviews.text: This case is one of the best ventalated ive ever seen, and the best layout for atx ive ever seen, honestly love this thing. the magnetic filters are life savers too. even with dual 2080ti's, 4 SSD's, and 4 Memory chips, i still fit an AIO dual fan RAD, and 2 more fans in this case. power supply mounting is a little wonky, but its fairly easy to figure out. My only grief is the quality feel of the power and reset buttons, feel cheap. great budget case.
customer_reviews.author: Nate long

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: I got this case for my husband because his previous computer case was all tempered glass and way too big to fit on our desk and we didn't like having it sit on the floor. So this case was a nice improvement. It was smaller and able to sit nicely on our desk and my husband had no issues getting the parts switched over. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: This is my first PC case that I've bought, ever since I've decided to move from console to PC. Unlike others, I was nervous because I didn't know this is would handle things like I expected. I love it when I'm proved wrong, this is an amazing budget PC case: no problems, innovative, stable and this is an overall great shelter that should be acquired for efficient and productive gaming, streaming, designing, etc. If you're contemplating about this device, negatively, forget it. This device is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ana mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected.
customer_reviews.text: The case offers an easy and clean setup, its amazing for the price. I am running a Asus Strix B450-F (ATX) Gaming with a Ryzen 5, 3600X CPU and a GTX 2060 video card. It did run a bit hot, So I'll add a pair of 120MM fans from an old case to improve airflow. I'd use this case again for other sub-$1,000 builds.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: I got this case for a $500 build for my son. I am actually quite impressed with the amount of features and the build quality for the price. I remember when I first started building computers that case options were so limited and for the price I paid for this case what you got was flimsy and cheap looking. This case looks and feels more expensive than what the price leads you to believe. And my importantly my son loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cook

customer_reviews.title: Used cases for the price of new.
customer_reviews.text: Beware not every unit they send as new. My unit has definitely been used it was packaged in properly in the box in the plexiglass see-through front had scratches throughout. Missing multiple cover/access grills in the back of unit. missing multiple screws. If I don't have the spare parts to make this thing usable I will be returning it. Will update my review if Cooler Master resolves this.
customer_reviews.author: DVchickenman

customer_reviews.title: Great case, magnetic dust things are meh
customer_reviews.text: Great case! love the space for hiding wires on the backside, and the ability to mount the hdd/ssd's on the back as well. This has left me with ample space in the viewable portion for fans/airflow, or even something neat. Nice amount of screws provided as well. the magnetic dust things are meh, they move around too easily
customer_reviews.author: DwnldDude

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget case, lacks air flow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great. I’d get Pc case but it does lack good air flow so I would not use this for a higher end build.
customer_reviews.author: ProjectDraven

customer_reviews.title: Great matx case
customer_reviews.text: Great matx case, for the price I wasn't expecting much. very surprised and pleased. Fit was good, no sharp edges, everything drilled correctly. Feels solid? Installed in about an hour. The hard drive holders for ssd beat the trays in my main case hands down. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RT419

customer_reviews.title: 1 of the best mATX cases
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best bang for the buc cases you can get in this price range. Plenty of room on back side for cable management, can fit large GPU cards, and plenty of fan slots. My only gripe is there is only one 3.5" hdd mount on the backside of motherboard. Other than that this case is awesome! The whole thing is pretty much mesh / air vented so not going to be a quiet case.. but great for keeping gaming setups cool. I added some LED lights in mine and happy with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: C G

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm satisfied. It looks great. It's a shame that it only has two mounting points for HDD, but it has a space for extra HDD on the bottom. If it came with anything that can secure extra HDD, it would be nicer. I had to struggle with my big CPU cooler. But I could manage. I'm happy with this case. I would buy another one​.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lim

customer_reviews.title: Best case I've used - definitely a steal!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic case that offers lots of flexibility in terms of cable management, how you want to place the power buttons/USB headers, and how to display the internals. Slightly odd power supply mounting setup but overall supremely satisfied with the feel of the case. The magnetic dust catchers are visibly not attached to the case but that would be a minor gripe that the rest of the qualities make up for.
customer_reviews.author: Shaquille Stoutamire

customer_reviews.title: Good budget option
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case for the money, I upgraded to this from a $20 case so thermals weren't bad at all for me. Great aesthetics, black internal cables, good options for size and price. Couldn't get 140mm fans to mount but 2 x 120mm fans at the front seems to work fine. Side panel window is tinted acrylic.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L.

product_meta.title: Cooler Master MasterBox Q300L Micro-ATX Tower with Magnetic Design Dust Filter, Transparent Acrylic Side Panel, Adjustable I/O & Fully Ventilated Airflow, Black (MCB-Q300L-KANN-S00)
product_meta.description: Style:Q300L| Size:Micro-ATX TowerThe Master Box Q300L is your straightforward option in the lineup of the brand new Master Box Series from Cooler Master. A Series that might be small in size but excels in functionality and modularity without compromising on the thermal performance. Although the size wouldn't tell, the Master Box Q300L supports a standard ATX PSU which we don't see often in the market with this size. Based on the different system setup, the I/O panel can be adjusted to six different locations, three options at each side of the case. You can decide which setup fits your system best. Due to the cube design of the frame and special pattern design on the magnetic dust filter will make the chassis stand out from the rest. The combination of a practical design and the unique customizable outlook makes the Master Box Q300L The perfect choice for office and home.
feature_bullets: I/O panel can be adjusted in 6 different locations and the Case can be positioned: vertical or horizontal
Edge to Edge Acrylic Transparent Side Panel offers a full view inside
Body depth height: can support normal size ATX power supply
Front Magnetic Design Dust Filter with open perforated front, top and bottom for high air performance
Extra space behind the motherboard tray for hidden cable management

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,404 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
